intro: Prismatomeris parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered prismatomeris, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its small, white to pink flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
